statoPatrimoniale.description: Configurazione parametri per Stato Patrimoniale (Balance Sheet) - legge ricavi/costi da contoEconomico e revenueModel

workingCapital.dsoNote: Days Sales Outstanding - giorni medi incasso clienti B2B. Tipico: 30-60gg (B2C), 60-90gg (B2B)
workingCapital.dpoNote: Days Payable Outstanding - giorni medi pagamento fornitori. Ottimizza cash flow ma mantieni buoni rapporti
workingCapital.inventoryTurnoverNote: Rotazione magazzino (volte/anno). 6x = ~2 mesi stock. Hardware: 4-6x, Software: non applicabile

fixedAssets.capexNote: CapEx come % ricavi annuali. Investimenti in macchinari, attrezzature, infrastruttura. Startup early-stage: 5-10%
fixedAssets.depreciationRateNote: Tasso ammortamento annuale (%). 20% = vita utile 5 anni, 10% = 10 anni. Dipende da tipo asset
fixedAssets.initialPPENote: Property, Plant & Equipment iniziale (Mâ‚¬). Macchinari e attrezzature all'avvio
fixedAssets.intangiblesNote: Brevetti e proprietÃ  intellettuale (Mâ‚¬). Valore capitalizzato IP

funding.initialCashNote: Cassa iniziale (Mâ‚¬) - capitale founder + friends & family

rounds.note: Round seed - validazione prodotto e prototipo beta
Bridge round - prime vendite e traction
Series A - scaling e espansione mercato

funding.note: Schedule funding rounds. Modificare importi e timing in base a piano raccolta capitale

debt.note: Debiti e finanziamenti. Convertible notes vanno in equity alla conversione

otherLiabilities.accruedExpensesNote: Spese maturate ma non pagate (% OPEX mensile). Es: salari, utilities

deferredRevenue.description: Abbonamenti SaaS pre-pagati annuali - riconosciuti nel tempo
deferredRevenue.note: Se clienti pagano annualmente in anticipo, parte Ã¨ 'debito' verso servizio futuro

assumptions.workingCapitalBufferNote: Buffer di sicurezza working capital (15% ricavi)
assumptions.minimumCashBalanceNote: Cassa minima operativa (Mâ‚¬) - non scendere sotto

calculationSettings.useActualCashFlowNote: Se true, legge cash flow da cashflow.ts. Se false, stima semplificata

productsAndServices.name: Eco 3D - Ecografo Portatile 3D
productsAndServices.description: Dispositivo ecografico portatile con imaging 3D real-time e AI

painRelievers.description: Imaging 3D elimina limiti 2D, AI assiste interpretazione
SaaS abbatte costi da â‚¬50K a â‚¬500/mese

gainCreators.description: 3D + AI portano accuratezza a livello ospedaliero

elevatorPitch.content: Eco 3D Ã¨ il primo ecografo portatile con imaging volumetrico 3D real-time e intelligenza artificiale assistita. Portiamo la qualitÃ  diagnostica degli ecografi ospedalieri da â‚¬50.000+ in un dispositivo portatile da meno di 2kg a â‚¬500/mese. I medici ottengono immagini 3D in 15 minuti invece di 25, con accuratezza diagnostica superiore del 35% rispetto agli ecografi 2D standard. Eliminiamo la necessitÃ  di referral a centri specializzati, accelerando la diagnosi di 5 giorni e aumentando la patient retention del 40%. Perfetto per ambulatori, pronto soccorso e visite domiciliari.

narrativeFlow.hook: Il 70% delle diagnosi mediche si basa su imaging, ma solo il 15% delle strutture sanitarie ha accesso a ecografi 3D.
narrativeFlow.problem: Gli ecografi tradizionali costano â‚¬50.000+, sono ingombranti, producono solo immagini 2D limitate e richiedono settimane di training. Risultato: diagnosi meno accurate, referral costosi, perdita di revenue.
narrativeFlow.solution: Eco 3D Ã¨ il primo ecografo portatile (<2kg) con imaging 3D real-time e AI assistita, a â‚¬500/mese invece di â‚¬50.000 upfront.
narrativeFlow.how: Tecnologia proprietaria: sensori multi-element, algoritmi di ricostruzione volumetrica real-time, deep learning per segmentazione. Cloud platform PACS integrato. Certificato CE MDR Classe IIa.
narrativeFlow.proof: 25 strutture pilota. +35% accuratezza vs 2D. Tempo esame -40%. Patient retention +40%, revenue +â‚¬120/paziente. Payback <18 mesi. NPS 72.
narrativeFlow.vision: Democratizzare imaging 3D medico. Da 15% a 80% strutture con accesso a imaging 3D nei prossimi 5 anni.

positioningStatement.targetCustomer: Medici, radiologi e strutture sanitarie che necessitano di imaging 3D accessibile
positioningStatement.customerNeed: Ottenere immagini diagnostiche 3D accurate in modo rapido, portatile ed economicamente sostenibile
positioningStatement.keyBenefit: Imaging 3D real-time di livello ospedaliero in dispositivo portatile <2kg a â‚¬500/mese, con AI assistita
positioningStatement.primaryCompetitor: Ecografi tradizionali (GE, Philips, Siemens) ed ecografi portatili base (Butterfly iQ, Vscan)
positioningStatement.uniqueDifferentiator: Unica soluzione che combina imaging volumetrico 3D real-time + AI + portabilitÃ  estrema + modello SaaS accessibile

products.name: Voluson E10 / E8 / E6, Invenia ABUS

whyWeWin: Eco 3D offers true multi-probe autonomous scanning vs GE's manual operation
Near real-time 3D/4D (3-5 vol/s) vs GE's slower volumetric acquisition
Multi-district capability vs GE's single-district focus (ABUS)
Compact handheld design vs GE's cart-based systems
Lower cost per exam through automation
theirStrengths: HDlive rendering is industry gold standard
Extensive clinical validation and FDA clearances
theirWeaknesses: Manual scanning still required - operator dependent
ABUS automation limited to breast only
battlecard.competitiveResponse: GE has the image quality and brand, but Eco 3D revolutionizes the workflow with autonomous multi-probe scanning that works across all anatomical districts, not just specialized applications. Our 3-5 vol/s real-time capability and compact design address the key limitations of traditional cart-based systems.

whyWeWin: Eco 3D is general-purpose multi-organ vs Philips' cardiology focus
Autonomous multi-probe scanning vs manual operation
Robotically guided positioning vs operator skill dependent
theirStrengths: xMATRIX live 3D Echo is best-in-class for cardiac
AI quantification tools for cardiac assessment
theirWeaknesses: Requires expert operators for cardiac studies
Not portable or suitable for POCUS
battlecard.competitiveResponse: Philips excels in cardiac imaging, but Eco 3D offers a broader solution for multi-organ autonomous scanning. While they optimize for expert cardiologists, we democratize advanced imaging through automation and AI guidance across all anatomical regions.

whyWeWin: Eco 3D extends hands-free to ANY organ vs Siemens breast-only
Multi-probe simultaneous scanning vs single transducer
3-5 vol/s real-time vs slow offline reconstruction
AI-native multi-angle fusion vs manual positioning
One device for all anatomical regions
theirStrengths: Proven ABVS technology for breast screening
Strong clinical evidence for dense breast
theirWeaknesses: Requires separate system for general ultrasound
battlecard.competitiveResponse: Siemens pioneered automated breast scanning, validating the hands-free concept. Eco 3D takes this proven approach and applies it universally across all anatomical districts with faster imaging (3-5 vol/s) and AI-driven multi-angle fusion.

whyWeWin: Automated multi-probe volumetric acquisition vs Canon's manual 3D
Wider angular coverage without manual maneuvering
Multi-district capability in one scan session
theirStrengths: Leading micro-flow imaging for small vessels
battlecard.competitiveResponse: Canon has innovative 3D visualization (fly-through), but Eco 3D eliminates the manual acquisition challenge through automated multi-probe scanning. We combine Canon's visualization goals with autonomous workflow that reduces operator dependency.

marketPosition.region: Asia, Middle East, Growing in Europe

strengths: S-Detect AI for breast lesion characterization
Fast-growing market share in Asia and Middle East
weaknesses: Newer brand with less clinical legacy than GE/Philips
Limited service network in some regions
opportunities: Expand beyond women's health to multi-organ
Leverage Samsung's consumer electronics expertise for POCUS
threats: Eco 3D multi-organ approach vs single specialty
Portable AI-driven systems (Butterfly, Clarius) disrupting low-end

whyWeWin: Eco 3D is multi-organ, not just obstetrics
Standardized exams across all anatomical regions
theirWeaknesses: Women's health focus limits addressable market
Operator skill still critical for quality
Newer player with less clinical evidence
battlecard.competitiveResponse: Samsung has impressive 4D rendering and modern UI, but Eco 3D addresses the broader challenge of operator-independent, multi-organ autonomous scanning. While they optimize the visual experience, we revolutionize the acquisition workflow.
Delphinus has innovative transmission tomography for breast. Eco 3D offers broader reflection imaging for any anatomy.

threats: Eco 3D has working pMUT multi-array now

battlecard.competitiveResponse: QT has niche quantitative transmission. Eco 3D offers broader AI quantitative across all organs.

weaknesses: Non autonomo: dipende da operatore remoto, nessuna fusione multi-sonda
threats: Eco 3D: â€¢ Ecografia autonoma senza operatore remotoâ€¢ Fusione multi-sonda e AI-guidata per ricostruzione 3D/4D

weaknesses: Dipende da operatore remoto; solo imaging 2D; zero volumetria
threats: Eco 3D: â€¢ Ecografia autonoma multi-sonda senza operatore remotoâ€¢ Volumetria 3â€“5 vol/s con AI di fusione e super-risoluzione

SonoSite leads POCUS and ABUS separately. Eco 3D merges: portable 3D volumetric across all districts.
Mindray competes on price with decent 3D/4D. Eco 3D offers breakthrough autonomous multi-probe.
Esaote serves MSK niche. Eco 3D offers premium multi-organ including MSK with automation.
Butterfly democratized ultrasound access with â‚¬2k pricing. Eco 3D targets premium autonomous 3Dâ€”different segments.
Clarius offers wireless convenience with good 2D. Eco 3D extends to multi-probe 3D/4D volumetric with automation.

threats: Eco 3D has working pMUT multi-array now

battlecard.competitiveResponse: Exo promises future pocket 3D AI ultrasound. Eco 3D delivers working multi-probe autonomous 3D/4D today.
EchoNous uses AI to guide manual scanning. Eco 3D automates the acquisition with AI-driven multi-probe volumetric fusion.

theirWeaknesses: Separate device needed for general US
battlecard.competitiveResponse: GE Invenia pioneered automated breast scanning. Eco 3D extends this automation universally across all organs with faster imaging.

whyWeWin: Hands-free for ANY organ vs breast-only
battlecard.competitiveResponse: Siemens pioneered automated breast scanning. Eco 3D takes this hands-free concept universally across all anatomy.

competitiveRivalry.description: Intense competition among established players with aggressive innovation and pricing
factors: Market dominated by 5 major players: GE (28%), Philips (22%), Siemens (18%), Canon (12%), Samsung (8%)
High fixed costs drive volume competition
Technology convergence: All offer 3D/4D, AI, cloud connectivity
Price wars in mid-range segment (Mindray, emerging players)
Innovation race: CMUT, pMUT, AI auto-measurements, fusion imaging
Emerging threats: Butterfly (â‚¬2k), Clarius (â‚¬8k) disrupting low end
Service network and installed base create switching costs but also competitive pressure
competitiveRivalry.impact: Fierce competition on price, features, and innovation - margins under pressure

threatNewEntrants.description: High barriers to entry limit new traditional players, but technology shifts enable startups
factors: Regulatory barriers: FDA 510(k) requires 12-24 months and â‚¬500k-â‚¬2M
High R&D investment: â‚¬10M-â‚¬50M for full system development
Established brand trust critical in medical device purchasing
BUT: CMUT/pMUT technology enables new entrants (Butterfly â‚¬2k disruption)
AI and software differentiation lower traditional hardware barriers
Cloud platforms and smartphone integration reduce console costs
threatNewEntrants.impact: Traditional barriers weakening due to technology shift - startups entering at low end

bargainingPowerSuppliers.description: Specialized transducer manufacturers and semiconductor suppliers have moderate power
factors: Limited number of high-quality transducer manufacturers (Vermon, Broadsound, Imasonic)
CMUT/pMUT silicon chips require specialized semiconductor fabs (TSMC, Intel)
Custom ASIC design increases switching costs
Long qualification periods (6-12 months) for new suppliers
Growing competition in CMUT manufacturing reduces power
bargainingPowerSuppliers.impact: Moderate pressure on component costs and supply chain reliability

bargainingPowerBuyers.description: Hospitals and imaging centers have strong negotiating power due to high purchase volumes
factors: Large hospital systems (HCA, Ascension) purchase in volume
GPO (Group Purchasing Organizations) negotiate bulk discounts 20-40%
High switching costs but long replacement cycles (7-10 years) create leverage
Reimbursement pressure from payers drives price sensitivity
Multiple viable alternatives (GE, Philips, Siemens) increase buyer power
bargainingPowerBuyers.impact: Significant downward pressure on pricing, especially for cart systems

threatSubstitutes.description: Limited direct substitutes for ultrasound, but alternative modalities compete in some applications
factors: CT: Superior bone/lung imaging but ionizing radiation, higher cost
MRI: Best soft tissue contrast but expensive (â‚¬1M+), slow (30-60 min scans), limited availability
X-ray: Bone imaging only, radiation, no soft tissue visualization
Ultrasound advantages: Real-time, portable, no radiation, low cost per exam (â‚¬50 vs â‚¬500 CT)
Growing AI-enabled ultrasound expanding into traditional CT/MRI territory
Point-of-care ultrasound (POCUS) substituting for physical exam + imaging
threatSubstitutes.impact: Low substitution threat - ultrasound has unique real-time + portability + safety combination

overallAttractiveness.summary: Medical ultrasound industry is moderately attractive with high rivalry and buyer power offset by low substitution threat and weakening entry barriers creating opportunity for innovation-driven disruption

perceptualMap.description: Posizionamento strategico su Innovation vs Automation

opportunities.name: High Innovation & High Automation
opportunities.description: White space: alta innovazione + alta automazione - posizione strategica di Eco 3D
